featured.name: David Rivas
featured.title: Research Assistant (2019-2026)
featured.bio: David joined the Muhle lab in December 2019 as a Research Assistant. His roles included conducting animal behavior, electroencephalography (EEG), computational analyses, histology, and laboratory/mouse colony management. In January 2026, David entered a new role as a Backend Developer at IBM.

featured.name: Sam Dhanani
featured.title: Research Assistant (2023-2025)
featured.bio: During her time in the lab, Sam studied the behavior and neural circuitry of Chd8 haploinsufficient mice. She pioneered assays such as operand conditioning and fiber photometry. Sam is currently a PhD student in Neuroscience and Behavior at University of Massachusetts Amherst.

featured.name: Yun-Kyung Kim
featured.title: Research Assistant (2020-2022)
featured.bio: During her time in the lab, Yun-Kyung studied the molecular biology of Chd8 haploinsufficiency in mice. She employed techniques such as chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP), RNA extraction, cDNA synthesis, qRT-PCR analysis, and western blotting. Additionally, she performed a comprehensive medical literature review of the association of likely damaging human CHD8 mutations with seizures and abnormal EEG. Yun-Kyung is currently a medical student at Wright State University Boonshoft School of Medicine.
